entry.title: [Office upload] Add ODFS reauthentication required (empty) state
entry.content:
Add ODFS reauthentication required (empty) state to be displayed when

navigation to ODFS failed due to a NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR error.

This error means that ODFS threw an ACCESS_DENIED error upon

onReadDirectoryRequested which indicates that reauthentication is

required.



Note: this image is not displayed when navigation succeeded but there

are no files to display. But if navigation fails, there will be no files

to display so the reauthentication required state is a type of empty

state.

This CL adds a few QoL improvements to the Metadata View:

* Render numbers using formatNumber(), to get comma separator.

from the corresponding "before" value.

JSON text that resembles the legacy Metadata View.

entry.title: [EnumSet] Refactor constructor usages
entry.content:
TL;DR: EnumSet variadic template ctor is being replaced with ctor

accepting std::initializer_list. Some usages are not compatible and this

CL updates them.



Implicit EnumValue->EnumSet conversions and direct calls of variadic

template constructor (e.g. EnumSet(value1,...)) don't work with

initializer_list ctor. This CL replaces them with:

1. [Only variables initializations] EnumSet set = {value1, ...};

2. [Only inside macro invocations] EnumSet({value1, ...})

3. Implicit construction from initializer_list (note that this is a

special case of implicit conversion, intentionally supported in STL

and by clang-tidy warnings):

foo(value1) -> foo({value1});

foo(EnumSet(value1, ...)) -> foo({value1, ...});

4. EnumSet(value1, ...) -> EnumSet{value1, ...};



Note that 3 and 4 are mostly the same, in most places I made a choice

that resembles pre-existing code closer (exceptions are mostly usages of

Sync EnumSets).



Motivation:

EnumSet variadic template constructor is defective in a sense that it

allows code like this to compile:

using ModelTypeSet = EnumSet;

void foo(ModelTypeSet set);

foo(ModelType()); // Typo, intended to pass empty ModelTypeSet.



The problem is that constructor is not explicit. Simply making it

explicit will disallow nice STL-like usage:

class C {

ModelTypeSet set = {HISTORY, BOOKMARKS};

};



STL and other containers under base/containers avoid this problem by

using std::initializer_list, this refactoring does the same for EnumSet.



This CL was uploaded by git cl split.



R=dcheng@chromium.org

entry.title: Fix flaky collapse-pre-linestart-1.html test
entry.content:
The above test is flaky due to the editable region not having focus on

occasion, leading to differences with the expected test baseline, which

does have focus. The test ref explicitly calls .focus() to focus the

editable region, which guarantees the presence of the focus ring prior

to test completion. The actual test does not call .focus(), which means

there could be a race between the browser establishing focus and test

execution completing. To fix this, the collapse-pre-linestart-1.html

test is being updated to call .focus() on the editable region.



The same pattern is observed in collapse-pre-linestart-2.html, thus

that test is also being updated herewith.



Bug: 1296445

entry.title: Relocate execute() logic to OmniboxAction implementations.
entry.content:
The logic and tests are moved with only minor updates applied to them

to use what's available (OmniboxActionDelegate) rather than immediate

calls.



Notable differences:

- startActivity returns boolean rather than throwing an exception

(this simplifies flow in OmniboxActionInSuggest#execute())

- Unit tests verifying certain behavior (e.g. non-interactable tabs)

are split into unit test that verifies page load action and a test

that confirms what happens if a tab is non-interactable.

- Test coverage should be more exhaustive.



No other differences.

entry.title: Revert "Reland "[dPWA] Add OsIntegrationSubManagers to field trial testing""
entry.content:
This reverts commit 195df62b68fa1798379a91f09ac0c695388c8e3a.



Reason for revert: See https://crbug.com/1444941



[Sheriff] Multiple Mac bots are failing.



Original change's description:

> Reland "[dPWA] Add OsIntegrationSubManagers to field trial testing"

>

> This is a reland of commit a167246101099d3fe7fcdc84af27cdde2ffa00d6

>

> This CL fixes the Mac failures on the revert build by ensuring that

> AppShimRegistry information is created for an app and profile as

> part of the ShortcutSubManager::Configure() flow. This is necessary

> for the FileHandlingSubManager calls to the AppShimRegistry inside

> its Configure() flow to execute, otherwise the correct data is not

> written to the AppShimRegistry. Previously, the ShortcutSubManager

> would only create the AppShimRegistry on new installs on Execute(),

> and the FileHandlingSubManager would not correctly store that

> information.

>

> Protocol Handling follows a similar path but it is not an issue

> because AppShimRegistry is touched only as part of the Execute flow,

> and it is always called AFTER ShortcutSubManager::Execute, so the

> AppShimRegistry is always created per app_id and profile.

>

> Duplicate calls to AppShimRegistry::OnAppInstalledForProfile() is

> fine, if the registry is already set up fr that profile and app_id,

> the function is a no-op and exits early.

>

> Tested by running all the unit-tests for these 3 sub managers, on

> all Mac trybots from Mac 11-13 and the browsertests that failed on

> https://ci.chromium.org/p/chromium/builders/ci/Mac12%20Tests/9259.

>

> Original change's description:

> > [dPWA] Add OsIntegrationSubManagers to field trial testing

> >

> > Bug: b/277775035

> > Change-Id: I9d8c3d7b2f43481825bc951579ba3bf7a07ff4c8

> > Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4447618

entry.title: [ios] Update PlatformFontIOS metric calculation
entry.content:
This CL modifies the CalculateMetrics() method in the PlatformFontIOS

class to round up the calculated font metrics (height_, ascent_ and

cap_height_) using 'ceil'. Previously, these metrics were

directly assigned from the UIFont properties (CGFloat) to the integer

member variables, which caused the decimal part to be truncated.

The following test failures have been resolved by addressing this issue:



RenderTextTest.BaselineWithLineHeight

RenderTextTest.GetTextOffset

RenderTextTest.GetTextOffsetVerticalAlignment

RenderTextTest.GetTextOffsetVerticalAlignment_Multiline

RenderTextTest.MinLineHeight

RenderTextTest.MoveCursor_UpDown_Scroll

RenderTextTest.StringSizeMultiline

entry.title: [EnumSet] Refactor constructor usages
entry.content:
TL;DR: EnumSet variadic template ctor is being replaced with ctor

accepting std::initializer_list. Some usages are not compatible and this

CL updates them.



Implicit EnumValue->EnumSet conversions and direct calls of variadic

template constructor (e.g. EnumSet(value1,...)) don't work with

initializer_list ctor. This CL replaces them with:

1. [Only variables initializations] EnumSet set = {value1, ...};

2. [Only inside macro invocations] EnumSet({value1, ...})

3. Implicit construction from initializer_list (note that this is a

special case of implicit conversion, intentionally supported in STL

and by clang-tidy warnings):

foo(value1) -> foo({value1});

foo(EnumSet(value1, ...)) -> foo({value1, ...});

4. EnumSet(value1, ...) -> EnumSet{value1, ...};



Note that 3 and 4 are mostly the same, in most places I made a choice

that resembles pre-existing code closer (exceptions are mostly usages of

Sync EnumSets).



Motivation:

EnumSet variadic template constructor is defective in a sense that it

allows code like this to compile:

using ModelTypeSet = EnumSet;

void foo(ModelTypeSet set);

foo(ModelType()); // Typo, intended to pass empty ModelTypeSet.



The problem is that constructor is not explicit. Simply making it

explicit will disallow nice STL-like usage:

class C {

ModelTypeSet set = {HISTORY, BOOKMARKS};

};



STL and other containers under base/containers avoid this problem by

using std::initializer_list, this refactoring does the same for EnumSet.



This CL was uploaded by git cl split.



R=dcheng@chromium.org

metric is emitted on W/M/L/C.

UkmRecorder::GetSourceIdForDesktopWebAppStartUrl to

AppSourceUrlRecorder::GetSourceIdForPWA.

longer needed in daily_metrics_helper. Removed a test that checked this

behaviour.

entry.content:
The other major verifier implementations all implement this in various slightly conflicting ways, and seemingly no-one implements parsing of quoted-string local-parts in email addresses.



This implementation takes a conservative approach in what it allows, it also does not implement quoted-string parsing, but will fail on any addresses that uses it rather than (potentially incorrectly) allowing them.

entry.title: [EnumSet] Refactor constructor usages
entry.content:
TL;DR: EnumSet variadic template ctor is being replaced with ctor

accepting std::initializer_list. Some usages are not compatible and this

CL updates them.



Implicit EnumValue->EnumSet conversions and direct calls of variadic

template constructor (e.g. EnumSet(value1,...)) don't work with

initializer_list ctor. This CL replaces them with:

1. [Only variables initializations] EnumSet set = {value1, ...};

2. [Only inside macro invocations] EnumSet({value1, ...})

3. Implicit construction from initializer_list (note that this is a

special case of implicit conversion, intentionally supported in STL

and by clang-tidy warnings):

foo(value1) -> foo({value1});

foo(EnumSet(value1, ...)) -> foo({value1, ...});

4. EnumSet(value1, ...) -> EnumSet{value1, ...};



Note that 3 and 4 are mostly the same, in most places I made a choice

that resembles pre-existing code closer (exceptions are mostly usages of

Sync EnumSets).



Motivation:

EnumSet variadic template constructor is defective in a sense that it

allows code like this to compile:

using ModelTypeSet = EnumSet;

void foo(ModelTypeSet set);

foo(ModelType()); // Typo, intended to pass empty ModelTypeSet.



The problem is that constructor is not explicit. Simply making it

explicit will disallow nice STL-like usage:

class C {

ModelTypeSet set = {HISTORY, BOOKMARKS};

};



STL and other containers under base/containers avoid this problem by

using std::initializer_list, this refactoring does the same for EnumSet.



This CL was uploaded by git cl split.



R=dcheng@chromium.org

entry.title: [CR2023] Update the textfield border color only with the default border.
entry.content:
For ChromeRefresh2023, Textfields should not have a border outline when disabled or in read only state.



Originally, this was implemented by calling UpdateBorder when disabled or in read only

See: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4406814



This introduced a bug where we were creating a border for Textfields that did not want a border. Some UIs would call SetBorder and pass an empty border.



This is because Textfield::UpdateBorder() will override any existing borders originally called by Textfield::SetBorder.



We rolled back the implementation and this CL introduces a new fix.



Keep a flag that tracks if we're still using the default border. If so, update the border color for Disabled and ReadOnly states.



Bug: 1410804

entry.title: Propagate printer expired ssl certificate message to user
entry.content:
Currently, When a printer has an expired SSL certificate, any print jobs

sent to that printer will hang without any warning to the user. This

change propagates an error message to the user to let them know the cert

is expired and prompts them to restart the printer to hopefully create a

new SSL certificate.



This is one half of the set of changes needed to fix this bug.

The other CL can be found here: https://crrev.com/c/4424886



BUG=b:180721814

TEST=deployed and tested with ash and lacros on brya hardware

entry.title: Prerender: Ignore failures on query about memory footprint
entry.content:
This CL ignores failures on making a query about private memory

footprint on prerender start.



When memory footprint exceeds the limit, PrerenderHostRegistry cancels

prerendering. However, this query frequently fails and causes

cancellation regardless of actual memory consumption

(PrerenderFinalStatus::kFailToGetMemoryUsage). To avoid such an

unfortunate case, this CL allows to ignore the failures.



This change should be safe as PrerenderHostRegistry has the limit on the

number of ongoing prerendering requests and observes memory pressure

events to prevent excessive memory usage. Also this change is guarded by

a new feature flag, kPrerender2IgnoreFailureOnMemoryFootprintQuery, so

that we can revert the change with the field trial.



Bug: 1444521

entry.title: [EnumSet] Refactor constructor usages
entry.content:
TL;DR: EnumSet variadic template ctor is being replaced with ctor

accepting std::initializer_list. Some usages are not compatible and this

CL updates them.



Implicit EnumValue->EnumSet conversions and direct calls of variadic

template constructor (e.g. EnumSet(value1,...)) don't work with

initializer_list ctor. This CL replaces them with:

1. [Only variables initializations] EnumSet set = {value1, ...};

2. [Only inside macro invocations] EnumSet({value1, ...})

3. Implicit construction from initializer_list (note that this is a

special case of implicit conversion, intentionally supported in STL

and by clang-tidy warnings):

foo(value1) -> foo({value1});

foo(EnumSet(value1, ...)) -> foo({value1, ...});

4. EnumSet(value1, ...) -> EnumSet{value1, ...};



Note that 3 and 4 are mostly the same, in most places I made a choice

that resembles pre-existing code closer (exceptions are mostly usages of

Sync EnumSets).



Motivation:

EnumSet variadic template constructor is defective in a sense that it

allows code like this to compile:

using ModelTypeSet = EnumSet;

void foo(ModelTypeSet set);

foo(ModelType()); // Typo, intended to pass empty ModelTypeSet.



The problem is that constructor is not explicit. Simply making it

explicit will disallow nice STL-like usage:

class C {

ModelTypeSet set = {HISTORY, BOOKMARKS};

};



STL and other containers under base/containers avoid this problem by

using std::initializer_list, this refactoring does the same for EnumSet.



This CL was uploaded by git cl split.



R=dcheng@chromium.org



Bug: 1444105

entry.title: Reland "Convert selection range from surrounding_text relative to absolute"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 3f03c31432bac401bff6a1ea88c7a486c0deccf4.



Reason for revert: with fix of the bot failure.



Original change's description:

> Revert "Convert selection range from surrounding_text relative to absolute"

>

> This reverts commit e7849c730293deed91da4db92c5c2fd4ef18e03f.

>

> Reason for revert: GrammarManager unittests failing

> Bug:1444620

>

> Original change's description:

> > Convert selection range from surrounding_text relative to absolute

> >

> > GrammarFragments are represented by using indices in text field absolute,

> > while selection_range in SurroundingTextInfo is relative to

> > surrounding_text. So, if surrouding_text range is not starting from the

> > beginning of the text field, they'll mismatch.

> >

> > This CL converts the indices to text field absolute to make them

> > matched.

> >

> > BUG=1402906

> > TEST=Tryjob.

> > CQ_INCLUDE_TRYBOTS=luci.chrome.try:chromeos-betty-pi-arc-chrome

> >

> > Change-Id: I79a26688b02f3b13a9974e5fd1dd4be55774e838

entry.title: [scroll-animations] Disable CSSAnimationDelayStartEnd
entry.content:
We do not have a specific plan to ship this, and it's potentially

masking test coverage for what we do intend to ship. In particular,

we are testing an irrelevant alternative of the 'animation' shorthand

(-alternative-animation-with-delay-start-end) instead of the alternative

we plan to ship soon (-alternative-animation-with-timeline).



Disable CSSAnimationDelayStartEnd for now.

entry.title: Files Office: Dismiss educational nudge via keyboard
entry.content:
Implement the ability for a self dismiss nudge to be dismissed via

keyboard.



It's implemented via a function because the nudge and the anchor in the

tree doesn't have the focus to receive the keydown event. So instead we

listen to the keydown in the document and ask the nudge if it should be

dismissed in that keydown.

entry.title: [scroll-start] Parse scroll-start-target longhands
entry.content:
scroll-start-target is included in the scroll-snap-2 spec[1].



scroll-start-target, when set on the child of a scroller, is one of the

factors that determines the starting scroll position of that scroller.



[1] https://drafts.csswg.org/css-scroll-snap-2/#scroll-start

entry.title: [fedcm] Return WebContents* in ShowModalDialog for the IdentityRegistry
entry.content:
In this CL, we refactor the ShowModalDialog method to return the

modal 's WebContents*, so that the JS running in the modal dialog

can communicate back to the original caller through the

IdentityRegistry that gets installed.



The responsibility of opening the ShowModalDialog falls entirely now

onto the FederatedAuthRequest, which receives callbacks from the

UI controller.



For the IdP Sign-in Status API, we introduce a OnSignInToIdP handler,

implemented by the FederatedAuthRequestImpl, which gets called when

the user clicks on the failure dialog, which is then responsible

for opening the ShowModalDialog. The IdentityProvider.close() call

gets routed through the IdentityRegistry, which now calls a

NotifyClose() event in the callers FederatedAuthRequestImpl.



The AuthZ API follows the same pattern, and calls ShowModalDialog when

an on_continue response is passed back. The modal's JS can call

IdentityProvider.resolve() through the IdentityRegistry, which routes

to the caller's NotifyResolve().



Bug: 1429083

Change-Id: If41b96df69ba599ebd2264e588d734187563df8c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4517942

Reviewed-by: Alex Moshchuk

Commit-Queue: Sam Goto

Reviewed-by: Christian Biesinger

Reviewed-by: Zachary Tan

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1142957}

entry.title: Fix priority of tab switcher back press handler
entry.content:
When a tab with tab modal dialog enters the overview mode, a back press

tries to dismiss the dialog first.



TAB_SWITCHER was renamed from TAB_SWITCHER_TO_BROWSING, which did have

a lower priority than TAB_MODAL_HANDLER somehow in the control group.

[1]



Currently, no matter if start surface refactor is enabled or if start

surface is enabled, in the overview mode the back press will be handled

through layout manager's onBackPressed [2] when back press refactor is

disabled.



So this CL moves the priority of tab switcher handler next to

start surface.



[1] https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3854953/13/chrome/android/java/src/org/chromium/chrome/browser/ChromeTabbedActivity.java#b2284

[2] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/android/java/src/org/chromium/chrome/browser/app/ChromeActivity.java;l=2221

entry.title: [PDF OCR] Check the did_get_a_text_run flag when creating an OCR request
entry.content:
`did_get_a_text_run_` is used to determine whether a PDF page has

accessible text and to check if the PDF OCR status needs to be updated.

However, this flag was not being used to check if a PDF page needs to be

sent to an OCR service, which can result in some discrepancies. Thus,

use this flag when checking whether images from a PDF page need to be

sent the OCR service.



Note that `did_get_a_text_run_` gets updated when PDF accessibility

tree is updated for each PDF page. Thus, it's possible that only

subset of PDF pages could be sent to the OCR when PDF has only images

in earlier pages and accessible text in later pages. This behavior

needs to be updated with better heuristics for determining whether PDF

is inaccessible.



AX-Relnotes: n/a.

entry.title: [AXMode] Move Form Controls Filter to avoid crashes
entry.content:
The AXMode Form Controls experiment and testing on the Linux platform

revealed some crashes in specific test cases. One potential cause

of crashes is that the filter was occurring too early, filtering

out nodes necessary for preserving tree structure.



This CL forced the Form Controls AXMode on and ran the test suites

to determine a new appropriate location for the Form Controls filter.

The new location for the filter in

AXObject::ComputeAccessibilityIsIgnoredButIncludedInTree avoids any

test suite crashes. This should reduce the number of causes of crashes

during the experiment or eliminate them entirely.



This CL updates an expected file for a form-controls test and adds

a virtual test suite with --force-renderer-accessibility=form-controls.

entry.content:
The crash would occur when trying to register a PrefetchCookieListener

for a prefetch that had been reset within the call to

PrefetchService::Prefetch. The prefetch could be reset if it exceeded

the per-page prefetch limit. This CL moves the registration of a

PrefetchCookieListener to before the call to PrefetchService::Prefetch,

and adjusts the

PrefetchServiceLimitedPrefetchesTest.LimitedNumberOfPrefetches test so

that it would catch similar issues in the future.

entry.title: Fix potential issue in SharedDictionaryWriterOnDisk
entry.content:
There is a potential issue in SharedDictionaryWriterOnDisk that

when Append() was called multiple times, and then OnEntry() is called,

and if Entry::WriteData() synchronously succeeds, MaybeFinish() may

finishes the operation when the first buffer is written.



This is because MaybeFinish() checks `pending_write_buffers_.empty()`,

but `pending_write_buffers_` is cleared in OnEntry() by being moved to

`buffers`.



This CL solves this issue by using deque for `pending_write_buffers_`.



Note: Entry::WriteData() does not succeed synchronously when

CACHE_BACKEND_SIMPLE is used, so this issue does not occur in

production.



Bug: 1413922

entry.title: Reland "[dPWA] Add OsIntegrationSubManagers to field trial testing"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit a167246101099d3fe7fcdc84af27cdde2ffa00d6



This CL fixes the Mac failures on the revert build by ensuring that

AppShimRegistry information is created for an app and profile as

part of the ShortcutSubManager::Configure() flow. This is necessary

for the FileHandlingSubManager calls to the AppShimRegistry inside

its Configure() flow to execute, otherwise the correct data is not

written to the AppShimRegistry. Previously, the ShortcutSubManager

would only create the AppShimRegistry on new installs on Execute(),

and the FileHandlingSubManager would not correctly store that

information.



Protocol Handling follows a similar path but it is not an issue

because AppShimRegistry is touched only as part of the Execute flow,

and it is always called AFTER ShortcutSubManager::Execute, so the

AppShimRegistry is always created per app_id and profile.



Duplicate calls to AppShimRegistry::OnAppInstalledForProfile() is

fine, if the registry is already set up fr that profile and app_id,

the function is a no-op and exits early.



Tested by running all the unit-tests for these 3 sub managers, on

all Mac trybots from Mac 11-13 and the browsertests that failed on

https://ci.chromium.org/p/chromium/builders/ci/Mac12%20Tests/9259.



Original change's description:

> [dPWA] Add OsIntegrationSubManagers to field trial testing

>

> Bug: b/277775035

> Change-Id: I9d8c3d7b2f43481825bc951579ba3bf7a07ff4c8

entry.title: De-flake fenced frame dump accessibility test.
entry.content:
With fenced frames no longer supporting the 'src' attribute, the only

way to navigate a fenced frame is by installing a configuration using

the 'config' attribute. This means that a fenced frame will not

navigate until after the main page loads, and a fenced frame load will

no longer count as being part of the initial page load.



This causes the current fenced frame dump accessibility test to fail,

since the fenced frame will load after the test thinks the page is done

loading, causing the accessibility dump to not include anything from

inside of the fenced frame.



An earlier fix[1] attempted to de-flake the test by having it explicitly

wait for text that loads into the fenced frame to make it to the

accessibility dump, but that introduced a timeout issue where the test

would get stuck waiting for a final accessibility tree update.



Since the other attempts to de-flake didn't work, this CL simply has the

test wait for 100ms to give the fenced frame enough time to navigate.



[1]https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4475649



Change-Id: If1e8bca23f077e31f060de0f33ce94e5a595e84c

Bug: 1428918,1440049,1430008

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4503308

entry.title: FLEDGE: Make FindMatchingAd() less restrictive.
entry.content:
Interest group and bid are allowed to have size specified for the ad:

Interest group ad size: https://crrev.com/c/4321037

Bid ad size: https://crrev.com/c/4301312



Currently the FindMatchingAd() works like the following when the ad

from interest group and bid have the same url.

1. If neither ads has any size specifications -> matching

2. If only one of them has size -> not matching

3. If both have sizes

a) same sizes -> matching

b) different sizes -> not matching



This CL makes the behavior less restrictive. Point 2 above is now

considered as matching. The auction proceeds with the size present in

one of them ignored.



Bug: http://b/239866637

entry.title: Allow an AnimatedImageView to be started immediately.
entry.content:
AnimatedImageView::Play is document to only be valid when the View has a

Widget. But this is a little awkward because the ideal time for a caller

to call Play is often immediately after construction, and the View

itself is best-placed to know when it has been added to a widget.



So this change allows Play to be called whether a Widget is available

or not and, in the latter case, takes care of actually starting the

animation when it is attached to one.

entry.title: Add ExpandRectForPixelMovement()
entry.content:
FilterOperations::MaximumPixelMovement() is used to expand a rect to

include area that pixel moving filters can change. Pixel moving filters

aren't don't apply equally in all directions so a single value isn't

ideal. Add ExpandRectForPixelMovement() to do the expansion but keep

using the same MaximumPixelMovement() logic internally for now so this

should be essentially a no-op. There is a minor change in

DCLayerOverlay to use the shared helper function which rounds RectF up

to enclosing Rect.

entry.content:
Current code queries pref service to get a pref value and decides

whether to show the onboarding view. However, this code path is also

triggered during shutdown, where the pref service might be nullptr.

The fix is not to call the pref service during shutdown.

entry.title: FLEDGE: Add reject reasons for currency mismatches.
entry.content:
This required making it possible for the bidder worklet to specify the reject reason, not just the seller worklet, since it's what checks the generateBid currency.



See https://github.com/WICG/turtledove/issues/166#:~:text=If%20generateBid%20tries%20to%20bid%20in%20the%20wrong%20currency%2C%20it%27s%20an%20error%2C%20and%20the%20IG%20does%20not%20participate%20in%20the%20auction.%20(We%27ll%20need%20to%20add%20a%20new%20currency%20mismatch%20error%20to%20the%20enum%20of%20reasons%20a%20group%20didn%27t%20win.)



(This also does it for scoreAd in component auctions)

entry.title: [CrOS Cellular] Fix APN page causing erroneous backwards navigation
entry.content:
Fix the mobile data subpage navigating backwards to the top-level

Settings page when mobile data is disabled. This would occur if the user

had navigated to the at some point. This was because

has logic that checks if the network no longer exists, and

if so, it closes the page. However, in this case, the page is not

showing, however, it still gets triggered to close the page when mobile

data is disabled because the network no longer exists, causing the

mobile data subpage to navigate backwards. This is fixed by only

navigating backwards from when the network no longer

exists and the page is the current route.



Bug: b:281728200

Test: DUT and *ApnSubpage*

entry.title: [EnumSet] Add ctor accepting std::initializer_list
entry.content:
EnumSet variadic template constructor is defective in a sense that it

allows code like this to compile:

using ModelTypeSet = EnumSet;

void foo(ModelTypeSet set);

foo(ModelType()); // Typo, intended to pass empty ModelTypeSet.



The problem is that constructor is not explicit. Simply making it

explicit will disallow nice STL-like usage:

class C {

ModelTypeSet set = {HISTORY, BOOKMARKS};

};



The goal of the refactoring is to follow STL approach and replace

variadic templates ctor with initializer_list ctor. This is a first CL,

that adds initializer_list ctor, marks variadic templates ctor as

deprecated and updates usages in enum_set_unittest.cc.
